qas.question: How many launch titles did the 360 have in Japan?
What was the name of the Japanese developer that strongly supported the 360?
What was Mistwalker's first title for the 360?
Blue Dragon surpassed this sales figure in Japan?
What was Mistwalker's second 360 title to be released?
How many game pre-orders did the console have in its first year?
How many copies of the Phantasy Star Universe sold?
How many of the original six games available in Japan surpassed 200,000?
When was Mistwalker's second game released?

context: <a0_0>Six<a0_0/> games were initially available in Japan, while eagerly anticipated titles such as Dead or Alive 4 and Enchanted Arms were released in the weeks following the console's launch. Games targeted specifically for the region, such as Chromehounds, Ninety-Nine Nights, and Phantasy Star Universe, were also released in the console's first year. Microsoft also had the support of Japanese developer <a1_0>Mistwalker<a1_0/>, founded by Final Fantasy creator <b5_0>Hironobu Sakaguchi<b5_0/>. Mistwalker's first game, <a2_0>Blue Dragon<a2_0/>, was released in <b9_0>2006<b9_0/> and had a limited-edition bundle which sold out quickly with <b6_0>over 10,000<b6_0/> pre-orders. Blue Dragon is one of <b8_0>three<b8_0/> Xbox 360 games to surpass <a3_0><b7_0>200,000<b7_0/> units<a3_0/> in Japan, along with Tales of Vesperia and Star Ocean: The Last Hope. Mistwalker's second game, <a4_0>Lost Odyssey<a4_0/> also sold over 100,000 copies.
